prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the rotor dataset._x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_
- Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti_x000d__x000d_
- Set the active scalar array to "Pressure"._x000d__x000d_
- Apply a slice along the Y axis at 95% depth of the dataset (convert percentage to slice index)._x000d__x000d_
- Use a blue → white → red color map for pressure values, spanning from the minimum to maximum scalar range._x000d__x000d_
- Set opacity to fully opaque (no transparency variation)._x000d__x000d_
- Add an orientation marker with XYZ axes in the bottom-right corner._x000d__x000d_
- No interactive GUI controls are required._x000d__x000d_
ground_truth:

_x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_
generator_prompt:
You are a VTK.js visualization expert. Based on the user's requirements and the provided VTK.js examples, generate complete and functional HTML code that meets all specified requirements.
    Please follow these guidelines:
    1. Generate complete HTML code that can run independently
    2. Use the VTK.js library from CDN (https://unpkg.com/vtk.js@34.10.0/vtk.js)
    3. Implement ALL requirements specified in the user question
    4. Add detailed comments explaining how each requirement is implemented
    5. Ensure the visualization is displayed properly without UI controls unless specifically requested
    6. Pay special attention to data loading paths and visualization parameters
    7. The data format for generating code is vti format, please use the correct IO module,The system reading method does not support HttpDatasetReader. Please use another appropriate module, such as vtkXMLImageDataReader
    Important: Highlight in comments how each specific user requirement is addressed in the code.
evaluator_prompt:
# Role

You are an expert Evaluator for vtk.js and web-based scientific visualization. Your task is to compare the [GENERATED_CODE] against the [GROUND_TRUTH] and evaluate it based on specific dimensions.

# Input Data

## Ground Truth Code:

[GROUND_TRUTH]

## Generated Code:

[GENERATED_CODE]

# Evaluation Criteria & Rubric (0.0 to 1.0)

Please evaluate the generated code based on the following 3 dimensions. 

1. **Functionality & Completeness (Task Completion)**: 
   - Does the code implement the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth? (e.g., correct readers, mappers, filters).
   - Are critical elements present (e.g., color transfer functions, full-screen rendering)?
   - Score 1.0 if logic is identical; lower if steps are missing.

2. **Visual Fidelity (Visual Quality)**:
   - Based on the code logic, will the visual output look similar to the ground truth?
   - Check camera parameters, background colors, and opacity transfer functions.
   - Check if the correct data arrays (scalars/vectors) are selected for coloring.

3. **Code Quality & Maintainability**:
   - Is the code readable, well-structured, and using vtk.js best practices?
   - Is the variable naming clear?

# Response Format

You must output the evaluation in the following Strict XML format. Do not use Markdown block quotes.

<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>[AVERAGE_SCORE]</OverallScore>
        <Critique>[ONE_SENTENCE_SUMMARY]</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

evaluator_evaluation.evaluator_evaluation:
<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>0.9</Score>
        <Reason>The generated code implements the same core visualization pipeline: loading a VTI dataset, slicing along Y at 95%, coloring by 'Pressure' with a custom color map, and adding an orientation widget. However, it uses setJSlice() instead of setSlicingMode(1) + setSlice(), which is functionally equivalent but less explicit. Also, it omits resetting the camera clipping range, which may affect rendering in some edge cases.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>0.85</Score>
        <Reason>The color mapping (blue-white-red) matches the ground truth, and the slice position is correct. However, the background is dark gray ([0.2,0.2,0.2]) instead of white ([1,1,1]), and the container height is fixed at 600px rather than full-screen, altering the visual context. The opacity setup is correct, but the absence of resetCameraClippingRange may cause subtle depth issues.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>0.95</Score>
        <Reason>The code is well-structured, readable, and follows vtk.js best practices. It explicitly initializes renderer, render window, and interactor (more modular than FullScreenRenderWindow), uses clear variable names (e.g., ctfun, ofun), and includes helpful comments. Minor redundancy in calling setViewportCorner twice slightly reduces elegance.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>0.9</OverallScore>
        <Critique>The generated code is highly functional and maintainable but deviates slightly in visual presentation due to background color and layout differences, and omits a minor camera adjustment.</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

Functionality.reason: The generated code implements the same core visualization pipeline: loading a VTI dataset, slicing along Y at 95%, coloring by 'Pressure' with a custom color map, and adding an orientation widget. However, it uses setJSlice() instead of setSlicingMode(1) + setSlice(), which is functionally equivalent but less explicit. Also, it omits resetting the camera clipping range, which may affect rendering in some edge cases.

VisualQuality.reason: The color mapping (blue-white-red) matches the ground truth, and the slice position is correct. However, the background is dark gray ([0.2,0.2,0.2]) instead of white ([1,1,1]), and the container height is fixed at 600px rather than full-screen, altering the visual context. The opacity setup is correct, but the absence of resetCameraClippingRange may cause subtle depth issues.

CodeQuality.reason: The code is well-structured, readable, and follows vtk.js best practices. It explicitly initializes renderer, render window, and interactor (more modular than FullScreenRenderWindow), uses clear variable names (e.g., ctfun, ofun), and includes helpful comments. Minor redundancy in calling setViewportCorner twice slightly reduces elegance.

parsed_evaluation.critique: The generated code is highly functional and maintainable but deviates slightly in visual presentation due to background color and layout differences, and omits a minor camera adjustment.

However, it uses setJSlice() instead of setSlicingMode(1) + setSlice(), which is functionally equivalent but less explicit. </Evaluation>

analysis.description: Load the rotor dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataReader.
Set the active scalar array to 'Pressure' on the loaded image data.
Compute the slice index at 95% depth along the Y-axis based on dataset dimensions, then extract that slice using vtkImageSlice.
Create a blue → white → red color transfer function mapped to the full scalar range of 'Pressure'. Set opacity to fully opaque using a piecewise function with constant value 1.
Configure vtkImageMapper with the sliced data, color map, and opacity settings for rendering.
Add an XYZ axes orientation marker in the bottom-right corner using vtkOrientationMarkerWidget and vtkAxesActor.
Initialize renderer, render window, and interactor; add the image slice actor and orientation marker; then render the scene.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-ImageLabelOutline\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Displays a 2D image volume with an outlined labelmap. Specific regions (high/low values) are highlighted in red/green with transparent outlines.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-ImageSlice\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Generates and displays a 2D random image (100x100) using `vtkImageSlice` and `vtkImageMapper`.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-MultiImageSlice\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Loads a 3D volume and displays three orthogonal image slices (I, J, K planes) at the 30th layer using `vtkHttpDataSetReader` and `vtkImageSlice`.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Rendering-Image2D\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Displays a synthetic 2D image generated by `vtkRTAnalyticSource` using `vtkImageMapper` and `vtkImageSlice`.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Rendering-MultiSliceImageMapper\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Loads a 3D volume (`headsq.vti`) and displays three orthogonal slices (I, J, K) with interactive controls for position and color properties.
